\sphinxAtStartPar
Welcome to the WOOX Trading Bot documentation! This bot automates cryptocurrency trading on the WOOX exchange using various technical analysis strategies.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:getting-started}}\label{\detokenize{getting_started::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide will help you set up and run the WOOX Trading Bot.


\section{Prerequisites}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:prerequisites}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.8 or higher

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
WOOX API account and credentials

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Virtual environment (recommended)

\end{itemize}


\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:installation}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clone the repository:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/HoncyLee/AlgoTradeWooxAPI.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }AlgoTradeWooxAPI
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create and activate virtual environment:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Using virtualenvwrapper}
mkvirtualenv\PYG{+w}{ }woox
workon\PYG{+w}{ }woox

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Or using venv}
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }venv
\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }venv/bin/activate\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} On macOS/Linux}
venv\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}\PYGZbs{}}Scripts\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}\PYGZbs{}}activate\PYG{+w}{   }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} On Windows}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install dependencies:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}r\PYG{+w}{ }requirements.txt
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install Sphinx for documentation (optional):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYGZhy{}rtd\PYGZhy{}theme\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYGZhy{}autodoc\PYGZhy{}typehints
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{enumerate}


\section{API Credentials Setup}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:api-credentials-setup}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
You need to create API credentials on WOOX exchange:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Visit \sphinxhref{https://support.woox.io/hc/en-us/articles/4410291152793--API-creation}{https://support.woox.io/hc/en\sphinxhyphen{}us/articles/4410291152793\textendash{}API\sphinxhyphen{}creation}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create API key with trading permissions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add credentials to your shell configuration

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For \sphinxstylestrong{macOS/Linux} users, add to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciitilde{}/.zshrc}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciitilde{}/.bashrc}}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}KEY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}your\PYGZus{}api\PYGZus{}key\PYGZus{}here\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}SECRET}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}your\PYGZus{}api\PYGZus{}secret\PYGZus{}here\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Then reload:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZti{}/.zshrc\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} or source \PYGZti{}/.bashrc}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:configuration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Edit the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.config}} file in the project root:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Trading Configuration}
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{paper}\PYG{+w}{          }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} \PYGZsq{}paper\PYGZsq{} or \PYGZsq{}live\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n+na}{SYMBOL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}\PYG{+w}{      }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Trading pair}
\PYG{n+na}{BASE\PYGZus{}URL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{https://api.woox.io}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strategy Selection}
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} ma\PYGZus{}crossover, rsi, bollinger\PYGZus{}bands}
\PYG{n+na}{EXIT\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strategy Parameters}
\PYG{n+na}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}
\PYG{n+na}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{50}
\PYG{n+na}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{3.09}
\PYG{n+na}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{5.0}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Trading Parameters}
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{100}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{First Run \sphinxhyphen{} Paper Trading}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:first-run-paper-trading}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Always test with paper trading first:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TRADE\_MODE=paper}} in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.config}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run the trading bot:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
workon\PYG{+w}{ }woox\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Activate environment}
python\PYG{+w}{ }trade.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Monitor the output:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
2025\PYGZhy{}11\PYGZhy{}23 10:30:00 \PYGZhy{} Trade \PYGZhy{} INFO \PYGZhy{} Trade class initialized for symbol: SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT in PAPER mode
üíπ BTC/USDT: \PYGZdl{}37,250.50 | Entries: 45/1440 | Running...
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Stop the bot with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Ctrl+C}}

\end{enumerate}


\section{Verify Setup}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:verify-setup}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run verification tests to ensure everything works:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Verify signal generation and stop\PYGZhy{}loss logic}
python\PYG{+w}{ }verify\PYGZus{}signals.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test API connectivity}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}api.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test trading workflow}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}trade\PYGZus{}workflow.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{View Account Summary}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:view-account-summary}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check your paper trading account:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
workon\PYG{+w}{ }woox
python\PYG{+w}{ }account.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For live account (requires API credentials):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }account.py\PYG{+w}{ }live
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

jupyter\PYG{+w}{ }notebook\PYG{+w}{ }portfolio\PYGZus{}monitor.ipynb
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Troubleshooting}
\label{\detokenize{getting_started:troubleshooting}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Database not found}:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Databases are created automatically on first run. If you see this error, ensure you have write permissions in the project directory.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{API authentication failed}:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify your API credentials are correctly set in environment variables. Run \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{echo \$WOOX\_API\_KEY}} to check.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Module not found errors}:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure virtual environment is activated (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{workon woox}}) and all dependencies are installed.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Connection timeout}:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check your internet connection and verify WOOX API is accessible at \sphinxurl{https://api.woox.io}

\end{description}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Configuration Guide}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:configuration-guide}}\label{\detokenize{configuration::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide explains all configuration options for the WOOX Trading Bot.


\section{Configuration File}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:configuration-file}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.config}} file contains all trading parameters. Create it in the project root if it doesn‚Äôt exist.


\section{Trading Mode}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:trading-mode}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{paper}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} \PYGZsq{}paper\PYGZsq{} or \PYGZsq{}live\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{paper}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Simulates all trades without placing real orders

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Safe for testing strategies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Records to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{paper\_transaction.db}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No API credentials required for basic functionality

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{live}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Places actual orders on the exchange

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires valid API credentials

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Records to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{live\_transaction.db}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚ö†Ô∏è \sphinxstylestrong{Uses real money \sphinxhyphen{} be careful!}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Symbol Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:symbol-configuration}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{SYMBOL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} or PERP\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{SPOT\_BTC\_USDT}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Spot trading (buy and hold)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long positions only

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
No funding fees

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Direct asset ownership

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{PERP\_BTC\_USDT}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Perpetual futures

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Supports long and short positions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Has funding fees

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Better for strategy testing

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Strategy Selection}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:strategy-selection}}

\subsection{Entry Strategy}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:entry-strategy}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} ma\PYGZus{}crossover, rsi, bollinger\PYGZus{}bands}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{ma\_crossover} (Moving Average Crossover):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long: Short MA crosses above Long MA

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short: Short MA crosses below Long MA

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Parameters: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{SHORT\_MA\_PERIOD}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LONG\_MA\_PERIOD}}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{rsi} (Relative Strength Index):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long: RSI crosses above oversold threshold

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short: RSI crosses below overbought threshold

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Parameters: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RSI\_PERIOD}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RSI\_OVERSOLD}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{RSI\_OVERBOUGHT}}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{bollinger\_bands}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long: Price touches lower band

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short: Price touches upper band

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Parameters: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BB\_PERIOD}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BB\_STD\_DEV}}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{Exit Strategy}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:exit-strategy}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{EXIT\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Usually same as entry strategy}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
All strategies use stop\sphinxhyphen{}loss and take\sphinxhyphen{}profit for exits.


\section{Strategy Parameters}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:strategy-parameters}}

\subsection{Moving Average Crossover}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:moving-average-crossover}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}\PYG{+w}{   }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Fast moving average period}
\PYG{n+na}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{50}\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Slow moving average period}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shorter periods = More signals, more false positives

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Longer periods = Fewer signals, more reliable

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Common combinations: 20/50, 50/200, 10/30

\end{itemize}


\subsection{RSI Strategy}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:rsi-strategy}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{14}\PYG{+w}{        }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} RSI calculation period}
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERSOLD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{30}\PYG{+w}{      }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Oversold threshold (buy signal)}
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERBOUGHT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{70}\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Overbought threshold (sell signal)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RSI \textless{} 30: Oversold (potential buy)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RSI \textgreater{} 70: Overbought (potential sell)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Standard settings work well for most markets

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Bollinger Bands}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:bollinger-bands}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{BB\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}\PYG{+w}{         }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Moving average period}
\PYG{n+na}{BB\PYGZus{}STD\PYGZus{}DEV}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{2.0}\PYG{+w}{       }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Standard deviations for bands}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
2.0 std dev: Contains \textasciitilde{}95\% of price action

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Lower values: Tighter bands, more signals

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Higher values: Wider bands, fewer signals

\end{itemize}


\section{Risk Management}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:risk-management}}

\subsection{Stop Loss}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:stop-loss}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{3.09}\PYG{+w}{   }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Stop loss percentage}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Automatically closes losing positions:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long position: Closes when price drops 3.09\% below entry

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short position: Closes when price rises 3.09\% above entry

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Protects capital from large losses

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Take Profit}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:take-profit}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{5.0}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Take profit percentage}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Automatically closes winning positions:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Long position: Closes when price rises 5\% above entry

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short position: Closes when price drops 5\% below entry

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Locks in profits before reversals

\end{itemize}


\section{Trading Parameters}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:trading-parameters}}

\subsection{Trade Amount}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:trade-amount}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{100}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Dollar amount per trade}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Determines position size in USD

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bot calculates quantity: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{quantity = TRADE\_AMOUNT\_USD / current\_price}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Start small (\$10\sphinxhyphen{}50) when testing live

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Update Interval}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:update-interval}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{UPDATE\PYGZus{}INTERVAL\PYGZus{}SECONDS}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{60}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Seconds between trading decisions}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
How often to check for entry/exit signals

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
60 seconds = 1 minute bars

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Lower values = More CPU/API usage

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Don‚Äôt set below 10 seconds (rate limit risk)

\end{itemize}


\section{Logging Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:logging-configuration}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{LOG\PYGZus{}LEVEL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{INFO}\PYG{+w}{       }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR}
\PYG{n+na}{LOG\PYGZus{}FILE}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{trade.log}\PYG{+w}{   }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Log file location}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{DEBUG}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Most verbose

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shows all operations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use for troubleshooting

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{INFO}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Standard logging

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shows trades and important events

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Recommended for production

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{WARNING}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Only warnings and errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Minimal output

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{ERROR}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Only errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Very quiet

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\label{\detokenize{configuration:base-url}}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Don‚Äôt change unless using testnet or different environment.

\label{\detokenize{configuration:example-configurations}}

\PYG{n+na}{SYMBOL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}
\PYG{n+na}{EXIT\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}
\PYG{n+na}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}
\PYG{n+na}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{50}
\PYG{n+na}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{3.09}
\PYG{n+na}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{5.0}
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{50}
\PYG{n+na}{UPDATE\PYGZus{}INTERVAL\PYGZus{}SECONDS}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{60}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\PYG{n+na}{SYMBOL}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{PERP\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}

\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{200}
\PYG{n+na}{UPDATE\PYGZus{}INTERVAL\PYGZus{}SECONDS}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{15}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Best Practices}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:best-practices}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Always start with paper trading}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Test configuration for at least 24 hours}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Start with small amounts} (\$10\sphinxhyphen{}50) in live mode

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Monitor closely} for first few days

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Keep stop loss reasonable} (2\sphinxhyphen{}5\% range)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Don‚Äôt over\sphinxhyphen{}optimize} on limited data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Understand the strategy} before using it

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Log everything} (keep LOG\_LEVEL=INFO)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Regular backups} of transaction database

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Review performance} weekly using portfolio analysis

\end{enumerate}

\label{\detokenize{configuration:environment-variables}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
These override \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.config}} values and should be set in your shell:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}KEY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}your\PYGZus{}key\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}SECRET}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}your\PYGZus{}secret\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}paper\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Optional override}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Priority: Environment Variables \textgreater{} .config file


\section{Configuration Validation}
\label{\detokenize{configuration:configuration-validation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The bot validates configuration on startup:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Checks required parameters exist

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validates numeric ranges

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensures strategy names are valid

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verifies API credentials for live mode

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If validation fails, you‚Äôll see error messages with specific issues.

\chapter{Trading Strategies}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:trading-strategies}}\label{\detokenize{strategies::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The WOOX Trading Bot supports multiple trading strategies through a modular design. This guide explains each strategy and how to create custom ones.


\section{Strategy Architecture}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:strategy-architecture}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All strategies inherit from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseStrategy}} and implement two methods:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{generate\_entry\_signal(price\_history, orderbook)}} \sphinxhyphen{} Determines when to open positions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{generate\_exit\_signal(position, current\_price, orderbook)}} \sphinxhyphen{} Determines when to close positions

\end{itemize}


\section{Built\sphinxhyphen{}in Strategies}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:built-in-strategies}}

\subsection{Moving Average Crossover}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:moving-average-crossover}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{How It Works}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses two moving averages (fast and slow) to identify trend changes:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate short\sphinxhyphen{}term MA (default: 20 periods)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate long\sphinxhyphen{}term MA (default: 50 periods)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Long Signal}: Short MA crosses above Long MA (golden cross)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Short Signal}: Short MA crosses below Long MA (death cross)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Configuration}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}
\PYG{n+na}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}
\PYG{n+na}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{50}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Advantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Simple and reliable

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Works well in trending markets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clear entry signals

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fewer false signals than oscillators

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Disadvantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Lagging indicator (late entries)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Poor performance in ranging markets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires longer history (50+ candles)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Best For}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Trending markets (strong up/down moves)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Longer timeframes (1 hour+)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Conservative traders

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Code}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{MovingAverageCrossover}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{config\PYGZus{}loader}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{CONFIG}

\PYG{n}{strategy} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{MovingAverageCrossover}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{CONFIG}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strategy}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{long}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Buy signal \PYGZhy{} Bullish crossover}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{short}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Sell signal \PYGZhy{} Bearish crossover}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{RSI Strategy}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:rsi-strategy}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{How It Works}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses Relative Strength Index to identify overbought/oversold conditions:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate RSI over 14 periods (default)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Long Signal}: RSI crosses above 30 (oversold \(\rightarrow\) recovery)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Short Signal}: RSI crosses below 70 (overbought \(\rightarrow\) reversal)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Configuration}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{rsi}
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{14}
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERSOLD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{30}
\PYG{n+na}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERBOUGHT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{70}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Advantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Catches reversals early

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Works in ranging markets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clear overbought/oversold levels

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fast response to price changes

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Disadvantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Can stay oversold/overbought for extended periods

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
False signals in strong trends

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires tuning for different markets

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Best For}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ranging/choppy markets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mean reversion trading

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shorter timeframes (5\sphinxhyphen{}30 minutes)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Active traders

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{RSI Interpretation}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{0\sphinxhyphen{}30}: Oversold (potential buy)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{30\sphinxhyphen{}70}: Neutral zone

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{70\sphinxhyphen{}100}: Overbought (potential sell)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Code}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{RSIStrategy}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{config\PYGZus{}loader}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{CONFIG}

\PYG{n}{strategy} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{RSIStrategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{CONFIG}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strategy}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{long}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Buy signal \PYGZhy{} RSI oversold reversal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Bollinger Bands}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:bollinger-bands}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{How It Works}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses price volatility bands to identify extreme price levels:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate 20\sphinxhyphen{}period moving average (middle band)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate standard deviation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Upper band = MA + (2 √ó std dev)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Lower band = MA \sphinxhyphen{} (2 √ó std dev)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Long Signal}: Price touches/breaks lower band

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Short Signal}: Price touches/breaks upper band

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Configuration}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+na}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{bollinger\PYGZus{}bands}
\PYG{n+na}{BB\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{20}
\PYG{n+na}{BB\PYGZus{}STD\PYGZus{}DEV}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{2.0}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Advantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Adapts to volatility automatically

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Visual price extremes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Works in various market conditions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Good for mean reversion

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Disadvantages}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Can ‚Äúwalk the band‚Äù in strong trends

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Requires adjustment for different volatility

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
May generate signals in continued trends

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Best For}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mean reversion strategies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Volatility trading

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Range\sphinxhyphen{}bound markets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Medium timeframes (15\sphinxhyphen{}60 minutes)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Band Interpretation}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Price at lower band}: Potentially oversold

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Price at middle band}: Fair value

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Price at upper band}: Potentially overbought

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Narrow bands}: Low volatility (breakout coming)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Wide bands}: High volatility

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Example Code}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{BollingerBandsStrategy}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{config\PYGZus{}loader}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{CONFIG}

\PYG{n}{strategy} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{BollingerBandsStrategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{CONFIG}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strategy}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Exit Strategies}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:exit-strategies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All strategies use the same exit logic by default:


\subsection{Stop\sphinxhyphen{}Loss Exit}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:stop-loss-exit}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Closes position when losses exceed threshold:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Long position}
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{close\PYGZus{}position}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Short position}
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{close\PYGZus{}position}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Take\sphinxhyphen{}Profit Exit}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:take-profit-exit}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Closes position when profits exceed threshold:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Long position}
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{close\PYGZus{}position}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Short position}
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{n}{entry\PYGZus{}price} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{close\PYGZus{}position}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Creating Custom Strategies}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:creating-custom-strategies}}

\subsection{Basic Template}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:basic-template}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{BaseStrategy}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{typing}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Optional}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{collections}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{deque}

\PYG{k}{class}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nc}{MyCustomStrategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{BaseStrategy}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Your custom trading strategy.\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{deque}\PYG{p}{,}
                             \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Optional}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Optional}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{        }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Generate entry signal.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Returns:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{            \PYGZsq{}long\PYGZsq{}, \PYGZsq{}short\PYGZsq{}, or None}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Your logic here}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{some\PYGZus{}condition}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{long}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{other\PYGZus{}condition}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{short}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}

    \PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{generate\PYGZus{}exit\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{position}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
                            \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{float}\PYG{p}{,}
                            \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Optional}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n+nb}{bool}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{        }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Generate exit signal.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Returns:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{            True to close position, False to hold}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Usually use default stop\PYGZhy{}loss/take\PYGZhy{}profit}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{super}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}exit\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{position}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{current\PYGZus{}price}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Register Your Strategy}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Add to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.py}}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{STRATEGY\PYGZus{}REGISTRY} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ma\PYGZus{}crossover}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{MovingAverageCrossover}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{rsi}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{RSIStrategy}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{bollinger\PYGZus{}bands}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{BollingerBandsStrategy}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{my\PYGZus{}strategy}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{MyCustomStrategy}\PYG{p}{,}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Add yours here}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Advanced: Using Orderbook Data}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:advanced-using-orderbook-data}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Strategies can access deep orderbook data for advanced analysis:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{deque}\PYG{p}{,}
                         \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Optional}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Optional}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Access orderbook metrics}
        \PYG{n}{bid\PYGZus{}depth} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{bid\PYGZus{}depth}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{ask\PYGZus{}depth} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{orderbook}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ask\PYGZus{}depth}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{imbalance} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{bid\PYGZus{}depth} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{ask\PYGZus{}depth}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{bid\PYGZus{}depth} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{ask\PYGZus{}depth}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Use in decision making}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{imbalance} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.3}\PYG{p}{:}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strong buying pressure}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{long}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{imbalance} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.3}\PYG{p}{:}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strong selling pressure}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{short}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Strategy Selection Guide}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:strategy-selection-guide}}

\subsection{Choose Based on Market Conditions}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:choose-based-on-market-conditions}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Trending Markets} (clear up/down direction):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Moving Average Crossover

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Trend\sphinxhyphen{}following strategies

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Ranging Markets} (sideways movement):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RSI Strategy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bollinger Bands

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Mean reversion strategies

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{High Volatility}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bollinger Bands

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Wider stop losses

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shorter timeframes

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Low Volatility}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Moving averages with shorter periods

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Breakout strategies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Longer holding periods

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{Choose Based on Trading Style}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:choose-based-on-trading-style}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Swing Trading} (days to weeks):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
MA Crossover (50/200)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Longer timeframes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Wider stop losses (3\sphinxhyphen{}5\%)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Day Trading} (hours to days):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
MA Crossover (20/50)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RSI Strategy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Medium stop losses (2\sphinxhyphen{}3\%)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Scalping} (minutes to hours):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bollinger Bands

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
RSI with tight settings

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Tight stop losses (0.5\sphinxhyphen{}1\%)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Backtesting Strategies}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:backtesting-strategies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Test your strategy before deploying:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test signal generation}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}signals.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test complete workflow}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}trade\PYGZus{}workflow.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Verify signal logic}
python\PYG{+w}{ }verify\PYGZus{}signals.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Strategy Performance Metrics}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:strategy-performance-metrics}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Track these metrics to evaluate strategy performance:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Win Rate}: \% of profitable trades

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Profit Factor}: Gross profit / Gross loss

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Average Win/Loss}: Mean profit vs mean loss

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Max Drawdown}: Largest peak\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}trough decline

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Sharpe Ratio}: Risk\sphinxhyphen{}adjusted returns

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Use the portfolio analysis notebook to calculate these.


\section{Best Practices}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:best-practices}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Test thoroughly} in paper mode first

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Understand the strategy} before using it

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Don‚Äôt over\sphinxhyphen{}optimize} on limited data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Use appropriate timeframes} for each strategy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Adjust parameters} based on market conditions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Monitor performance} and adapt

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Keep stop losses} reasonable

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Don‚Äôt mix conflicting strategies}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Consider market volatility}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Review trades regularly}

\end{enumerate}


\section{Common Pitfalls}
\label{\detokenize{strategies:common-pitfalls}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Curve Fitting}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Optimizing too much on historical data. Strategy fails in live trading.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Ignoring Market Conditions}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using trend strategy in ranging market (or vice versa).

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Too Many Signals}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Short MA periods generate excessive trades and fees.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Ignoring Risk Management}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
No stop loss or take profit. One bad trade wipes out profits.

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Emotional Override}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Manually closing positions against strategy signals.

\end{description}

\section{Core Modules}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:core-modules}}

\subsection{trade}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:trade}}

\subsubsection{Trade Class}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:trade-class}}

\subsection{signal}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:module-signal}}\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!signal@\spxentry{signal}}\index{signal@\spxentry{signal}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{signal() (in module signal)@\spxentry{signal()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.signal}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{signal}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{signalnum}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{handler}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the action for the given signal.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The action can be SIG\_DFL, SIG\_IGN, or a callable Python object.
The previous action is returned.  See getsignal() for possible return values.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{* IMPORTANT NOTICE *}
A signal handler function is called with two arguments:
the first is the signal number, the second is the interrupted stack frame.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{getsignal() (in module signal)@\spxentry{getsignal()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.getsignal}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{getsignal}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{signalnum}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return the current action for the given signal.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{The return value can be:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
SIG\_IGN \textendash{} if the signal is being ignored
SIG\_DFL \textendash{} if the default action for the signal is in effect
None    \textendash{} if an unknown handler is in effect
anything else \textendash{} the callable Python object used as a handler

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{pthread\_sigmask() (in module signal)@\spxentry{pthread\_sigmask()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.pthread_sigmask}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{pthread\_sigmask}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{how}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{mask}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fetch and/or change the signal mask of the calling thread.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{sigpending() (in module signal)@\spxentry{sigpending()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.sigpending}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sigpending}}}
{}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Examine pending signals.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns a set of signal numbers that are pending for delivery to
the calling thread.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{sigwait() (in module signal)@\spxentry{sigwait()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.sigwait}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sigwait}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sigset}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Wait for a signal.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Suspend execution of the calling thread until the delivery of one of the
signals specified in the signal set sigset.  The function accepts the signal
and returns the signal number.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{valid\_signals() (in module signal)@\spxentry{valid\_signals()}\spxextra{in module signal}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api_reference:signal.valid_signals}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{signal.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_signals}}}
{}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a set of valid signal numbers on this platform.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The signal numbers returned by this function can be safely passed to
functions like \sphinxtitleref{pthread\_sigmask}.

\section{Database Schema}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:database-schema}}

\subsection{trades Table}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:trades-table}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All transactions are recorded in this DuckDB table:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{CREATE}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{TABLE}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{trades}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{(}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{acct\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{              }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Account identifier}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{symbol}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{               }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Trading pair (e.g., SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{trade\PYGZus{}datetime}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{TIMESTAMP}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Transaction timestamp}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{exchange}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{             }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Exchange name (woox)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{               }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Signal that triggered trade}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{trade\PYGZus{}type}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{           }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} BUY or SELL}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{quantity}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{DOUBLE}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{           }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Quantity traded (+ for buy, \PYGZhy{} for sell)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{price}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{DOUBLE}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{              }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Execution price}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{proceeds}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{DOUBLE}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{           }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Total value (negative for buys)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{commission}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{DOUBLE}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{         }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Commission paid}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{fee}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n}{DOUBLE}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{                }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Additional fees}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{order\PYGZus{}type}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{+w}{           }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} Order type (LMT, MKT, etc.)}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n}{code}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{TEXT}\PYG{+w}{                  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} O=Open position, C=Close position}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Trading}
\PYG{n}{TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{paper}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n}{SYMBOL} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{SPOT\PYGZus{}BTC\PYGZus{}USDT}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{n}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Moving Average}
\PYG{n}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{20}
\PYG{n}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{50}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} RSI}
\PYG{n}{RSI\PYGZus{}PERIOD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{14}
\PYG{n}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERSOLD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{30}
\PYG{n}{RSI\PYGZus{}OVERBOUGHT} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{70}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Bollinger Bands}
\PYG{n}{BB\PYGZus{}PERIOD} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{20}
\PYG{n}{BB\PYGZus{}STD\PYGZus{}DEV} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mf}{2.0}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Risk Management}
\PYG{n}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.09}
\PYG{n}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mf}{5.0}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Timing}
\PYG{n}{UPDATE\PYGZus{}INTERVAL\PYGZus{}SECONDS} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{60}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{API Endpoints}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:api-endpoints}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
WOOX API v3 endpoints used:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{BASE\PYGZus{}URL} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{https://api.woox.io}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Public endpoints (no auth)}
\PYG{n}{GET} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{public}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{orderbook}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Get orderbook data}
\PYG{n}{GET} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{public}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{marketTrades}    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Get recent trades}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Authenticated endpoints}
\PYG{n}{GET} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{asset}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{balances}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Get account balance}
\PYG{n}{GET} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{trade}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{orders}            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Get open orders}
\PYG{n}{POST} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{trade}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{order}            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Place new order}
\PYG{n}{DELETE} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{v3}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{trade}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{order}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Cancel order}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Exceptions and Errors}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:exceptions-and-errors}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Common exceptions you may encounter:
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{ValueError}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raised for invalid configuration or parameters:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{ValueError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Unknown} \PYG{n}{strategy}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{invalid\PYGZus{}strategy}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{FileNotFoundError}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raised when .config file is missing:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{FileNotFoundError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Configuration} \PYG{n}{file} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{found}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{config}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{ConnectionError}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raised for network/API issues:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{ConnectionError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Failed} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{connect} \PYG{n}{to} \PYG{n}{WOOX} \PYG{n}{API}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{KeyError}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Raised for missing configuration keys:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+ne}{KeyError}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{description}

\section{Test Scenarios}
\label{\detokenize{testing:test-scenarios}}

\subsection{Signal Generation Tests}
\label{\detokenize{testing:signal-generation-tests}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Bullish Crossover}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates 40 declining prices

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Then 20 rising prices

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects LONG signal when short MA crosses above long MA

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Bearish Crossover}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates 40 rising prices

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Then 20 declining prices

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects SHORT signal when short MA crosses below long MA

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{No Signal}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates stable prices (small variations)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects no signal (no crossover)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{Stop\sphinxhyphen{}Loss Tests}
\label{\detokenize{testing:stop-loss-tests}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Long Position Stop\sphinxhyphen{}Loss}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Opens long at \$95,000

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Price drops to \$91,565 (\sphinxhyphen{}3.59\%)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects exit signal (below \sphinxhyphen{}3.09\% threshold)

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Short Position Stop\sphinxhyphen{}Loss}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Opens short at \$95,000

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Price rises to \$98,435 (+3.59\%)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects exit signal

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{Take\sphinxhyphen{}Profit Tests}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Price drops to \$90,250 (\sphinxhyphen{}5.5\%)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Expects exit signal

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\label{\detokenize{testing:position-holding-test}}\begin{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\section{Interpreting Test Results}
\label{\detokenize{testing:interpreting-test-results}}

\subsection{Success Indicators}
\label{\detokenize{testing:success-indicators}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
‚úÖ PASS \PYGZhy{} Test passed successfully
\(\checkmark\) Success indicator

Example:
Result: ‚úÖ PASS
\(\checkmark\) Position opened successfully
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Failure Indicators}
\label{\detokenize{testing:failure-indicators}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
‚ùå FAIL \PYGZhy{} Test failed
‚úó Failure indicator

Example:
Result: ‚ùå FAIL
‚úó Signal not generated
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Warning Indicators}
\label{\detokenize{testing:warning-indicators}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning or issue
‚ÑπÔ∏è  Information

Example:
‚ö†Ô∏è  Database locked \PYGZhy{} this is normal during testing
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Test Output Analysis}
\label{\detokenize{testing:test-output-analysis}}

\subsection{Understanding Results}
\label{\detokenize{testing:understanding-results}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{All Tests Pass}:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
System is working correctly, ready for paper trading

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Signal Generation Fails}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check MA periods in configuration

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify price data has enough history

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure crossover pattern is strong enough

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Position Lifecycle Fails}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check database permissions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify configuration file exists

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure stop\sphinxhyphen{}loss/take\sphinxhyphen{}profit settings are correct

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Database Tests Fail}:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check write permissions in directory

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Close any programs accessing database

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Delete and recreate database files

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Troubleshooting Failed Tests}
\label{\detokenize{testing:troubleshooting-failed-tests}}

\subsection{Signal Generation Issues}
\label{\detokenize{testing:signal-generation-issues}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: No signal generated in crossover test

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check MA periods are appropriate:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{SHORT\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}
\PYG{n}{LONG\PYGZus{}MA\PYGZus{}PERIOD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure enough price data (need 50+ points)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify crossover pattern is strong enough

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: Wrong signal type (LONG instead of SHORT)

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check price data sequence

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify MA calculation logic

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Review crossover detection conditions

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Database Issues}
\label{\detokenize{testing:database-issues}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: Database locked error

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Close other programs accessing database

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Stop any running trade.py instances

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Wait a few seconds and retry

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: Table not found

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Delete existing database files

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Re\sphinxhyphen{}run tests to create fresh database

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify createDuckDB.py works

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{API Issues}
\label{\detokenize{testing:api-issues}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: Connection timeout

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check internet connection

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify WOOX API is accessible

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Try again in a few minutes (may be rate limited)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Problem}: Authentication failed

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Solutions}:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify API credentials in environment:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
echo \PYGZdl{}WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}KEY
echo \PYGZdl{}WOOX\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}SECRET
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check credentials are correct on WOOX

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure credentials have trading permissions

\end{enumerate}


\section{Manual Testing}
\label{\detokenize{testing:manual-testing}}

\subsection{Paper Trading Test}
\label{\detokenize{testing:paper-trading-test}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Best way to test overall system:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 1. Set paper mode}
vim\PYG{+w}{ }.config
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Set: TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE=paper}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 2. Start bot}
python\PYG{+w}{ }trade.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 3. Monitor for 1\PYGZhy{}2 hours}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Watch console output for signals and trades}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 4. Check results}
python\PYG{+w}{ }account.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Portfolio Analysis Test}
\label{\detokenize{testing:portfolio-analysis-test}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }portfolio\PYGZus{}analysis
jupyter\PYG{+w}{ }notebook\PYG{+w}{ }portfolio\PYGZus{}monitor.ipynb
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run all cells

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify balance fetches correctly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check transaction display

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Review P\&L calculations

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Configuration Validation}
\label{\detokenize{testing:configuration-validation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Test configuration changes:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test different strategies}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Edit .config: ENTRY\PYGZus{}STRATEGY=rsi}
python\PYG{+w}{ }verify\PYGZus{}signals.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test different parameters}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Edit .config: STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT=2.0}
python\PYG{+w}{ }verify\PYGZus{}signals.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Best Practices}
\label{\detokenize{testing:best-practices}}

\subsection{Pre\sphinxhyphen{}Deployment Testing}
\label{\detokenize{testing:pre-deployment-testing}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Before going live:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Run all test scripts successfully

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Test in paper mode for 24+ hours

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Verify signal generation produces trades

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Check stop\sphinxhyphen{}loss triggers correctly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Validate take\sphinxhyphen{}profit works as expected

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Review all transactions in database

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Test with different market conditions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚úÖ Monitor for errors in logs

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Regular Testing}
\label{\detokenize{testing:regular-testing}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
During operation:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Daily}: Check account summary

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Weekly}: Run verify\_signals.py

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Monthly}: Full test suite

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{After config changes}: Run all tests

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Continuous Integration}
\label{\detokenize{testing:continuous-integration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
For automated testing (future enhancement):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+ch}{\PYGZsh{}!/bin/bash}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} run\PYGZus{}tests.sh}

workon\PYG{+w}{ }woox

\PYG{n+nb}{echo}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Running verification tests...\PYGZdq{}}
python\PYG{+w}{ }verify\PYGZus{}signals.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{||}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{exit}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{1}

\PYG{n+nb}{echo}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Running workflow tests...\PYGZdq{}}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}trade\PYGZus{}workflow.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{||}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{exit}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{1}

\PYG{n+nb}{echo}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Running strategy tests...\PYGZdq{}}
python\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}signals.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{||}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{exit}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{1}

\PYG{n+nb}{echo}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}All tests passed!\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Adding New Tests}
\label{\detokenize{testing:adding-new-tests}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To add tests for custom strategies:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} test\PYGZus{}my\PYGZus{}strategy.py}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{signal}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}strategy}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{config\PYGZus{}loader}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{CONFIG}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{collections}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{deque}

\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{test\PYGZus{}my\PYGZus{}custom\PYGZus{}strategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Test custom strategy implementation.\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Setup}
    \PYG{n}{strategy} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}strategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{my\PYGZus{}strategy}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{CONFIG}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{deque}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{maxlen}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Add test price data}
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{60}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{price}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{95000} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{volume}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test entry signal}
    \PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{strategy}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}entry\PYGZus{}signal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{price\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{assert} \PYG{n}{signal} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{long}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{short}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{]}

    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{‚úÖ Custom strategy test passed: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{signal}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{test\PYGZus{}my\PYGZus{}custom\PYGZus{}strategy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\chapter{Deployment}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:deployment}}\label{\detokenize{deployment::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Guide for deploying the WOOX Trading Bot to production (live trading).


\section{Pre\sphinxhyphen{}Deployment Checklist}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:pre-deployment-checklist}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Before deploying to live trading, ensure:


\subsection{Testing}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:testing}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê All test scripts pass successfully

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Paper trading ran for 24+ hours without errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Signal generation produces expected trades

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Stop\sphinxhyphen{}loss triggers correctly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Take\sphinxhyphen{}profit triggers correctly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Database transactions record properly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Account summary displays correctly

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:configuration}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê API credentials verified and working

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Configuration file reviewed and validated

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Stop\sphinxhyphen{}loss and take\sphinxhyphen{}profit set appropriately

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Trade amount set to small value (\$10\sphinxhyphen{}50 for first trades)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Correct symbol selected (SPOT or PERP)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Strategy tested and understood

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Infrastructure}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:infrastructure}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Server/machine has stable internet connection

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Sufficient disk space for database and logs

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Process monitoring set up (systemd, supervisor, etc.)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Log rotation configured

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Backup strategy in place

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Monitoring}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:monitoring}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Alert system configured (email/SMS)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Log monitoring enabled

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Performance metrics tracking set up

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
‚òê Backup contact method for emergencies

\end{itemize}


\section{Live Trading Setup}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:live-trading-setup}}

\subsection{Step 1: Final Configuration}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:step-1-final-configuration}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Update \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.config}} for live trading:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Switch to live mode}
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}MODE}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{live}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Start with small amounts}
\PYG{n+na}{TRADE\PYGZus{}AMOUNT\PYGZus{}USD}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{25}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Conservative risk settings}
\PYG{n+na}{STOP\PYGZus{}LOSS\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{3.09}
\PYG{n+na}{TAKE\PYGZus{}PROFIT\PYGZus{}PCT}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{5.0}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Reasonable update interval}
\PYG{n+na}{UPDATE\PYGZus{}INTERVAL\PYGZus{}SECONDS}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s}{60}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Step 2: Verify API Credentials}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

============================

üìä API ACCOUNT BALANCE:
  USDT: 500.00000000
  BTC: 0.00000000

ls\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}lh\PYG{+w}{ }live\PYGZus{}transaction.db\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m}{2}\PYGZgt{}/dev/null\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{o}{||}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{echo}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Will be created on first run\PYGZdq{}}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Step 4: Initial Live Test}
\label{\detokenize{deployment:step-4-initial-live-test}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
workon\PYG{+w}{ }woox
python\PYG{+w}{ }trade.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check logs for any errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Monitor API balance changes

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Stop test run:}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Press \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Ctrl+C}} to gracefully stop the bot.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Review results:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }account.py\PYG{+w}{ }live
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
